thread.title: 5 signs Jose Mourinho reached full meltdown after Manchester United's goalless draw against Hull
thread.title_full: 5 signs Jose Mourinho reached full meltdown after Manchester United's goalless draw against Hull

author: Richard Innes
title: 5 signs Jose Mourinho reached full meltdown after Manchester United's goalless draw against Hull
text:
Sport 5 signs Jose Mourinho reached full meltdown after Manchester United's goalless draw against Hull The United manager's various bits of ranting at Old Trafford ticked all the boxes on the 'Mourinho Meltdown' checklist Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jose Mourinho rants after Hull draw Share this video Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho has always been prone to a post-match meltdown. 
A particularly emotional presence on the touchline, the Portuguese manager wears his heart very much on his sleeve. That perhaps explains why the Special One has a history of reacting badly after games where things haven't gone well for his team. 
Since joining Manchester United, Mourinho - on his best behaviour for his new bosses - has clearly been trying to curb this tendency for post-match strops. 
However, the 0-0 draw against Hull finally saw him revert back to Mourinho we know and love from his time at Chelsea: Meltdown Mourinho. (Photo: Julian Finney) 
In fact, the United boss' behaviour after the disappointing draw at Old Trafford bore all the hallmarks of a classic Mourinho mega-sulk. 
Let's quickly run through our checklist of what constitutes a Mourinho Meltdown and see how many of these boxes he ticked… Complaining he is the victim of a conspiracy? CHECK. (Photo: NicheMedia) 
“You know clearly that I'm different,” claimed Mourinho. “I'm different. The rules for me are different. 
If United lose at Leicester, don't be surprised if the United boss comes into the post-match press conference wearing a tinfoil hat, muttering about how the Premier League and The FA are trying to steal his thoughts. Thinly veiled rants about other managers? CHECK. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
